intro: Chionolaena phylicoides, commonly known as silverleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb with silver-gray foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and inland regions. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and easy care requirements.
